00059 static void nasl_thread (struct arglist *);
00060 
00061 
00079 struct arglist *
00080 nasl_plugin_add (char *folder, char *name, struct arglist *plugins,
00081                  struct arglist *preferences)
00082 {
00083   char fullname[PATH_MAX + 1];
00084   struct arglist *plugin_args;
00085   struct arglist *prev_plugin = NULL;
00086   int nasl_mode;
00087   nasl_mode = NASL_EXEC_DESCR;
00088   nvti_t *nvti;
00089 
00090   snprintf (fullname, sizeof (fullname), "%s/%s", folder, name);
00091 
00092   if (preferences_nasl_no_signature_check (preferences) > 0)
00093     {
00094       nasl_mode |= NASL_ALWAYS_SIGNED;
00095     }
00096 
00097   nvti = nvticache_get (arg_get_value(preferences, "nvticache"), name);
00098   plugin_args = plug_create_from_nvti_and_prefs (nvti, preferences);
00099   if (plugin_args == NULL)
00100     {
00101       nvti_free (nvti);
00102 
00103       plugin_args = emalloc (sizeof (struct arglist));
00104       arg_add_value (plugin_args, "preferences", ARG_ARGLIST, -1,
00105                      (void *) preferences);
00106       nvti = nvti_new ();
00107       arg_add_value (plugin_args, "NVTI", ARG_PTR, -1, nvti);
00108 
00109       if (exec_nasl_script (plugin_args, fullname, nasl_mode) < 0)
00110         {
00111           log_write ("%s: Could not be loaded", fullname);
00112           arg_set_value (plugin_args, "preferences", -1, NULL);
00113           arg_free_all (plugin_args);
00114           return NULL;
00115         }
00116 
00117       // this extra pointer was only necessary during parsing the
00118       // description part of a NASL. Now we can remove it from the args.
00119       if (arg_get_value (plugin_args, "NVTI"))
00120         arg_del_value (plugin_args, "NVTI");
00121 
00122       nvti_set_src (nvti, fullname);
00123 
00124       // Check mtime of plugin before caching it
00125       // Set to now if mtime is in the future
00126       struct stat plug_stat;
00127       time_t now = time (NULL) - 1;
00128       stat (fullname, &plug_stat);
00129       if (plug_stat.st_mtime > now)
00130         {
00131           struct utimbuf fixed_timestamp;
00132           fixed_timestamp.actime = now;
00133           fixed_timestamp.modtime = now;
00134           if (utime (fullname, &fixed_timestamp) == 0)
00135             log_write ("The timestamp for %s was from the future. This has been fixed.", fullname);
00136           else
00137             log_write ("The timestamp for %s is from the future and could not be fixed.", fullname);
00138         }
00139 
00140       if (nvti_oid (nvti) != NULL)
00141         {
00142           nvticache_add (arg_get_value(preferences, "nvticache"), nvti, name);
00143           arg_set_value (plugin_args, "preferences", -1, NULL);
00144           arg_free_all (plugin_args);
00145           nvti_free (nvti);
00146           nvti = nvticache_get (arg_get_value(preferences, "nvticache"), name);
00147           plugin_args = plug_create_from_nvti_and_prefs (nvti, preferences);
00148         }
00149       else
00150         // Most likely an exit was hit before the description could be parsed.
00151         log_write ("\r%s could not be added to the cache and is likely to stay"
00152                    " invisible to the client.", name);
00153     }
00154 
00155   if (plugin_args == NULL)
00156     {
00157       /* Discard invalid plugins */
00158       log_write ("%s: Failed to load", name);
00159       nvti_free (nvti);
00160       return NULL;
00161     }
00162 
00163   if (nvti_oid (nvti) == NULL)
00164     {
00165       /* Discard invalid plugins */
00166       log_write ("%s: Failed to load, no OID", name);
00167       nvti_free (nvti);
00168       plugin_free (plugin_args);
00169       return NULL;
00170     }
00171 
00172   arg_add_value (plugin_args, "OID", ARG_STRING, strlen (nvti_oid (nvti)), g_strdup (nvti_oid (nvti)));
00173   nvti_free (nvti);
00174 
00175   plug_set_launch (plugin_args, LAUNCH_DISABLED);
00176   prev_plugin = arg_get_value (plugins, name);
00177 
00178   // Was a plugin with the same filename already loaded? If so, remove it.
00179   if (prev_plugin == NULL)
00180     arg_add_value (plugins, name, ARG_ARGLIST, -1, plugin_args);
00181   else
00182     {
00183       plugin_free (prev_plugin);
00184       arg_set_value (plugins, name, -1, plugin_args);
00185     }
00186 
00187   return plugin_args;
00188 }
00189 
00193 int
00194 nasl_plugin_launch (struct arglist *globals, struct arglist *plugin,
00195                     struct arglist *hostinfos, struct arglist *preferences,
00196                     kb_t kb, char *name)
00197 {
00198   int module;
00199   struct arglist *d = emalloc (sizeof (struct arglist));
00200 
00201   arg_add_value (plugin, "HOSTNAME", ARG_ARGLIST, -1, hostinfos);
00202   if (arg_get_value (plugin, "globals"))
00203     arg_set_value (plugin, "globals", -1, globals);
00204   else
00205     arg_add_value (plugin, "globals", ARG_ARGLIST, -1, globals);
00206 
00207 
00208   arg_set_value (plugin, "preferences", -1, preferences);
00209   arg_add_value (plugin, "key", ARG_PTR, -1, kb);
00210 
00211   arg_add_value (d, "args", ARG_ARGLIST, -1, plugin);
00212   arg_add_value (d, "name", ARG_STRING, strlen (name), name);
00213   arg_add_value (d, "preferences", ARG_ARGLIST, -1, preferences);
00214 
00215   module = create_process ((process_func_t) nasl_thread, d);
00216   arg_free (d);
00217   return module;
00218 }
00219 
00220 
00221 static void
00222 nasl_thread (struct arglist *g_args)
00223 {
00224   struct arglist *args = arg_get_value (g_args, "args");
00225   struct arglist *globals = arg_get_value (args, "globals");
00226   struct arglist *preferences = arg_get_value (g_args, "preferences");
00227   char *name = arg_get_value (g_args, "name");
00228   int soc = GPOINTER_TO_SIZE (arg_get_value (args, "SOCKET"));
00229   int i;
00230   int nasl_mode;
00231   GError *error = NULL;
00232 
00233   if (preferences_benice (NULL))
00234     {
00235       int nice_retval;
00236       errno = 0;
00237       nice_retval = nice (-5);
00238       if (nice_retval == -1 && errno != 0)
00239         {
00240           log_write ("Unable to renice process: %d", errno);
00241         }
00242     }
00243 
00244   /* XXX ugly hack */
00245   soc = dup2 (soc, 4);
00246   if (soc < 0)
00247     {
00248       log_write ("dup2() failed ! - can not launch the plugin\n");
00249       return;
00250     }
00251   arg_set_value (args, "SOCKET", sizeof (gpointer), GSIZE_TO_POINTER (soc));
00252   arg_set_value (globals, "global_socket", sizeof (gpointer),
00253                  GSIZE_TO_POINTER (soc));
00254   for (i = 6; i < getdtablesize (); i++)
00255     close (i);
00256   proctitle_set ("openvassd: testing %s (%s)",
00257                  arg_get_value (arg_get_value (args, "HOSTNAME"), "NAME"),
00258                  name);
00259   signal (SIGTERM, _exit);
00260 
00261   nasl_mode = NASL_EXEC_DONT_CLEANUP;
00262   if (preferences_nasl_no_signature_check (preferences) > 0)
00263     nasl_mode |= NASL_ALWAYS_SIGNED;
00264 
00265   if (preferences_drop_privileges (preferences))
00266     {
00267       int drop_priv_res = drop_privileges (NULL, &error);
00268       if (drop_priv_res != OPENVAS_DROP_PRIVILEGES_OK)
00269         {
00270           if (drop_priv_res != OPENVAS_DROP_PRIVILEGES_FAIL_NOT_ROOT)
00271             log_write ("Failed to drop privileges for %s\n", name);
00272           g_error_free (error);
00273         }
00274     }
00275 
00276   exec_nasl_script (args, name, nasl_mode);
00277   internal_send (soc, NULL,
00278                  INTERNAL_COMM_MSG_TYPE_CTRL | INTERNAL_COMM_CTRL_FINISHED);
00279 }
